items.text: Majoring in journalism (with a specialization in interactive multimedia) and computer science, with a minor in entrepreneurship. Relevant coursework includes Interactive Journalism, CS Data Structures, News Writing, Multimedia Storytelling, and UX Design.

items.title: Robertson Scholars Leadership Program
items.text: The Robertson Scholars Leadership Program gives a selective group of students a full- tuition scholarship and allows them to be “dual citizens” of both the University of North Carolina and Duke University, taking classes and even living at the opposite campus.

items.title: Thomas Jefferson High School for Science and Technology
items.text: “TJ,” as it is affectionately called, is a magnet high school that draws students from all over Northern Virginia to study science, technology, engineering and mathematics.

items.title: NBC
items.subtitle: Multimedia Journalism Intern
items.text: Worked in NBC's national newsroom for the Owned Stations division, reporting national stories and creating videos, graphics, and interactives for NBC's digital platforms.

items.title: The Delta Center
items.subtitle: Media Intern
items.text: Helped produce multimedia stories for the Delta Center’s “Most Southern Place on Earth” workshops, taking photos, producing video stories, and designing for printed marketing.

items.title: CustomInk

items.text: Worked as a software engineering intern with CustomInk’s eCommerce team, entirely rebuilding a complex internal system with MySQL, MongoDB, Ruby on Rails, and JS.

items.title: "Exploring Faceboook's News Landscape"
items.subtitle: Data Visualization
items.text: This interactive piece uses data visualizations to analyze data from the Facebook Pages of top news organizations to better understand how people interact with news content on Facebook.
